newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: SOCCER-SLAVIA PRAGUE WIN CZECH CUP FOR FIRST TIME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SLAVIA PRAGUE WIN CZECH CUP FOR FIRST TIME.

text.p: Slavia Prague earned themselves a place in European soccer competition next season, beating second division Dukla Prague 1-0 with a sudden-death goal in extra-time on Sunday to win the Czech-Moravian Cup.

Karel Rada scored the 'golden' goal 10 minutes into extra-time to give Slavia their first-ever national cup and salvage some pride after losing the first division title to local rivals Sparta Prague last week.

Slavia used their trademark smothering defensive tactics to foil Dukla pressure in regulation time. Both teams tried to attack from the start of extra-time, looking for the goal which would decide the match.
"It was excellent football," Slavia coach Frantisek Cipro said. "We had a lot of luck. We can thank (goalkeeper Jan) Stejskal for it by keeping the opposition off the scoreboard."

Dukla, the former army team under communism, have fallen on hard times in recent years. But despite Sunday's defeat they can take solace from the season, having regained a first division place by winning the second division title last week.
